variable.name: EVENT
variable.description: EVENT NUMBER ON SEQUENCE OF EVENTS
variable.value: MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION RECOGNIZED, WITH DIAGNOSTIC ELECTROCARDIOGRAM
MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION RECOGNIZED, WITHOUT DIAGNOSTIC ELECTROCARDIOGRAM, WITH ENZYMES AND HISTORY
MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION RECOGNIZED, WITHOUT DIAGNOSTIC ELECTROCARDIOGRAM, WITH AUTOPSY EVIDENCE, NEW EVENT (SEE ALSO CODE 09)
MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION UNRECOGNIZED, SILENT
MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION UNRECOGNIZED, NOT SILENT

ANGINA PECTORIS, FIRST EPISODE ONLY. IF DATE OF ANGINA PECTORIS WAS UNAVAILABLE, ANGINA PECTORIS IS DATED AS MIDPOINT OF INTERVAL BETWEEN MEDICAL ENCOUNTERS (FHS EXAMS, HOSPITALIZATIONS OR MD OFFICE VISITS). IF ANGINA PECTORIS OCCURRED WITH MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION OR CORONARY INSUFFICIENCY, THEN USE SAME DATE AS MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION OR CORONARY INSUFFICIENCY. BEFORE 1987, IF ANGINA PECTORIS OCCURED JUST BEFORE MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION OR CORONARY INSUFFICIENCY, THEN ANGINA PECTORIS DATE WAS AS
CORONARY INSUFFICIENCY, DEFINITE BY BOTH HISTORY AND ELECTROCARDIOGRAM.

QUESTIONABLE MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION AT EXAM 1, DATE SAME DATE AS EXAM 1 FOR ORIGINAL COHORT AND OFFSPRING COHORT. FOR THE OTHER COHORT GROUPS, A DATE OTHER THAN THE EXAM 1 DATE IS USED IF AVAILABLE. ANY QUESTIONABLE MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION EPISODE AT EXAM 1: DEFINITE MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION HISTORY WITHOUT ENZYMES OR AUTOPSY, OR POSSIBLE MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION-ELECTROCARDIOGRAM. DOES NOT INCLUDE QUESTIONABLE ANGINA PECTORIS.
MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION ACUTE AUTOPSY, NOT A NEW EVENT. THIS IS CODED WHEN THERE HAS BEEN A PREVIOUSLY CODED MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION (1 OR 2) AND THAT MYOCARDIAL INFARCATION SHOWS ON AUTOPSY.
DEFINITE CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT AT EXAM 1, BUT QUESTIONABLE TYPE.
ATHEROTHROMBOTIC INFARCTION
TRANSIENT ISCHEMIC ATTACK (ONLY THE 1ST TIA IS CODED)
CEREBRAL EMBOLISM
INTRACEREBRAL HEMORRHAGE
SUBARACHNOID HEMORRHAGE
OTHER CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT
QUESTIONABLE CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT AT EXAM 1, DATE OF EXAM 1 (UNLESS DATE AVAILABLE)
DEATH, NOT REVIEWED
DEATH, CORONARY HEART DISEASE SUDDEN, WITHIN 1 HOUR
DEATH, CORONARY HEART DISEASE, 1-23 HOURS, NONSUDDEN
DEATH, CORONARY HEART DISEASE, 24-47 HOURS, NONSUDDEN
DEATH, CORONARY HEART DISEASE, 48 HOURS OR MORE, NONSUDDEN
DEATH, CEREBROVASCULAR ACCIDENT
DEATH, OTHER CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE
DEATH, CANCER
DEATH, OTHER CAUSES
DEATH, CAUSE UNKNOWN
INTERMITTANT CLAUDICATION, DATE MIDPOINT OF INTERVAL AS ANGINA PECTORIS, ALSO DATE ONLY FIRST EVENT
QUESTIONABLE INTERMITTANT CLAUDICATION AT EXAM 1, USE EXAM 1 DATE FOR ORIGINAL COHORT AND OFFSPRING COHORT. FOR THE OTHER COHORT GROUPS, A DATE OTHER THAN THE EXAM 1 DATE IS USED IF AVAILABLE.
CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE NOT HOSPITALIZED, ON EXAM OR MD NOTES (IF CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE FOUND ON FHS EXAM, USE FHS EXAM DATE)
CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE HOSPITALIZED
QUESTIONABLE CONGESTIVE HEART FAILURE AT EXAM 1, USE EXAM 1 DATE FOR ORIGINAL COHORT AND OFFSPRING COHORT. FOR THE OTHER COHORT GROUPS, A DATE OTHER THAN THE EXAM 1 DATE IS USED IF AVAILABLE.

variable.name: date
variable.description: DATE OF EVENT, NUMBER OF DAYS SINCE EXAM 1
variable.comment: WHEN EXACT DATE IS UNAVAILABLE, AN APPROXIMATE DATE *OR* A MIDPOINT DATE BETWEEN TWO EXAMS, TWO MEDICAL ENCOUNTERS OR EXAM AND MEDICAL MAY BE USED.
